documents.document: @Gillian_Philip @elsieb60 They believe that it's symbolic of good practice. That's how detached from reality the SNP hive mind has become.
@HTScotPol Give the stylus a nudge, record's sticking again.
@Maureen56596209 Dunno. Personally I think SNP and see a beige Hillman Imp with a dodgy clutch â˜º
@jhalcrojohnston @KatePotts11 SNP hive mind at work. Independent thought frowned upon in that Party.
DUP's Sammy Wilson getting ripped into the ridiculousness of the SNP's position. Rather fun â˜º
@pault199 @johnredwood Spock. Except that Spock was logical.
@Maureen56596209 @r_richards @2351onthelist @RossFootball @Planet_Pedro He does. An erudite Killie fan. They do exist. I'm told.
@Maureen56596209 @r_richards @2351onthelist @RossFootball @Planet_Pedro Mr Ross. He's a Killie fan. He's eaten the pies.
@Frankiejambo Stephen can certainly be described by a short word beginning with "i", but that word is not "ironic" ðŸ˜
@Maureen56596209 @r_richards @2351onthelist @RossFootball @Planet_Pedro You do know that he's a Killie fan, not an Untouchable? Eh ...
@paulhutcheon That's why a large majority of us voted No in September 2014, Stephen. You *do* realise that Scotland voted No?
@GlasgowAlbum @Kallemet86 @thebestbond @BrianSpanner1 Horizontal recruitment has long been a recruitment tool favoured by the hard left â˜º
@D1rect0r @2351onthelist A 650-page, taxpayer-financed, party political, campaign leaflet was what it was.
@Antisaint13 @2351onthelist @StephenGethins I just caught the second half. That was poor enough. They really are a second rate bunch.
@2351onthelist Very few of them are potential MasterMind contenders.
@Antisaint13 @2351onthelist @StephenGethins I knew that. I could see his lips moving.
@MirrorPolitics I suppose they've got to do something with all those remaindered copies of Salmond's risible White Paper.
Grievance chimp Gethins (SNP Euro spokesperson!) ranting on, clearly oblivious to the fact that Scots voted No back in Sep 2014.
@Norvegicusbass @heyyouayeyou I'm sure it was an entirely innocent question from Jo Cockburn ðŸ˜ðŸ˜
@2351onthelist However, I'm a bit addicted to Daily Politics, especially when the excellent Jo Cockburn is doing it.
@2351onthelist Wish I had. She is a ridiculous woman.
@Norvegicusbass @heyyouayeyou Taz sounds likes nails scraping down a blackboard. Makes about as much sense too.
@DuffeyGraham 42% of Scots' Electorate voted remain. Only 67% of Scots bothered to vote. Hardly the "speaking for Scotland" claimed by SNP.
Taz shrieking on Daily Politics. Embarrassing.
@pwsimerimiaw It doesn't really. Corbyn is an arrogant man who is fixed in the absolute rightness of his views and dismissive of all others.
@JohnLeoNo1087 @2351onthelist @Feroxbill1 @yuilly12 @GoldKrisgold Muted that clown a while back. He's the arsehole's arsehole.
@Purfleetjohn It's more about Corbyn trying to coerce Labour Party people - and our MPs - to accept his own longtime anti-EU will.
@JamieRoss7 @BuzzFeedNews Or Sturgeon will do what, exactly? ðŸ˜
@AaronPSimons @OwenJones84 Round up the usual suspects.
@JamieRoss7 That one's right off the far end of the Mason-Monaghan scale of political idiocy.
@Gillian_Philip Handsome Anycans is not something I would immediately associate with Hamilton - town or team â˜º
@Gillian_Philip Why would you want to? They're one of the more mediocre teams in the SPL, and the town is no beauty spot either ðŸ˜
@NaeBorder Nicola will likely have offered wee Patrick extra sweeties in his Christmas stocking â˜º
@JonDonnis @notjarvis @nickjhope Only 313,209 of the membership were guilty of that idiocy. Lots of us were not.
@nickjhope No, it isn't any sort of mystery. Corbyn is only interested in what members want when it's the same as what he wants.
@Haitch7 Indy was supposed to make Toarries! disappear. And now it washes Trumps out as well? Indy - the miracle cure for everything â˜º
@2351onthelist @neiledwardlovat Starting to look like their Indy moment has passed, maybe?
@KatePotts11 @bjsw49 @hazelcowan @Edenberg6 @ToALouse @kevverage That'll do it too â˜º
@KatePotts11 @bjsw49 @hazelcowan @Edenberg6 @ToALouse @kevverage Hot toddies. No medical help at all, but you sleep better ðŸ˜
@KatePotts11 @bjsw49 @hazelcowan @Edenberg6 @ToALouse @kevverage I'm not. I just didn't recognise the acronym. I do now. Get well soon ðŸ˜
@kevverage @hazelcowan @Edenberg6 @ToALouse We missed that key point, Kevin. Sorry to bother you, will pay more attention next time â˜º
@KatePotts11 @bjsw49 @hazelcowan @Edenberg6 @ToALouse @kevverage That sounds familiar â˜º
@Edenberg6 This is nonsense. Three years out of date. No reason to retweet now.
@ka8895 @BritishSos @kevverage Right enough. Piece is three years out of date. Never noticed. So why is the daft Nat retweeting it now? â˜º
@bluejeanbaby01 Likely that's Eurovision added to the Nat boycott list. Must be nearly as long as Salmond's White Paper by now â˜º
@KatePotts11 @hazelcowan @Edenberg6 @ToALouse @kevverage What's GM-K, btw?
@KatePotts11 @hazelcowan @Edenberg6 @ToALouse @kevverage Because they can't mention the unicorns or money trees, or we'd all want one â˜º
@eddireader @bluejeanbaby01 Never answer any of the substantive issues, like the Â£10bn hole in the annual budget.
@eddireader @bluejeanbaby01 There is no debate, Eddi. You just churn out the same "Scots voices for Scots choices" nonsense over and over.
@hazelcowan @Edenberg6 @ToALouse @kevverage Funny, I've just said the same thing ðŸ˜€
@BritishSos Can't wait till @kevverage gets his hands on it. If any report actually exists, it's not named or sourced in the BfS puff piece.
@BritishSos That well-known SNP front organisation and SNP candidate supplier Business for Scotland is behind this nonsense.
@eddireader @bluejeanbaby01 There isn't a rise. Polls show support for independence is actually declining slightly.
@BritishSos There's a "new report" apparently. Where ain't clear. Not sure whether alleged report mentions unicorns or magic money trees.
@Edenberg6 @ToALouse So where's this "new report", then?
@bluejeanbaby01 @dmck52 @eddireader Eddi is a fine singer. She should stick in there, because she knows sweet naff all about economics â˜º
@AdolphusSpriggs @Paul1Singh I don't disagree. Still denying the reality of Corbyn's misrule is not loyalty, it's deliberate sabotage â˜º
@AdolphusSpriggs @Paul1Singh Cognitive dissonance. Their wee brains will implode if they now admit to themselves how wrong they've been.
@eddireader @bluejeanbaby01 And where are you planning to find the extra annual Â£10bn of taxes to plug the hole in Indy Scotland's budget?
@eddireader @bluejeanbaby01 What, like Education and the NHS, which have always been under the SNP's full fiscal control? ðŸ˜
@JohnLeoNo1087 Because they know Sturgeon's talking bollocks as usual? ðŸ˜
@theSNP @AngusRobertson Clarity? In Salmond's White Paper? ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜
@BBCDouglasF @BRRSC @BBCScotland @scotgov Surely if you were a Freemason, it would be a secret? ðŸ˜
@scottr0gers @BRRSC @HannahB4LiviMP One page of figures, IIRC. One. Whole document was bunkum. Risible.
@annkane20 @TheZephyrus1969 Tulip Siddiq. Education. Yeah, I know ðŸ˜
@stephenkb So Corb's 3-line whip means very little, really? Spineless as well as dim.
@Maureen56596209 Just how much more highly likelier than highly likelier to be almost inevitably likely is #indyref2 today, Mo? ðŸ˜ðŸ˜
@Imogenlemon02 @guardian This is not going to end well.
@mattyt339 @99_hp And that in itself tells us pretty much all we need to know about JC â˜º
@tartan_jack Regardless of the question, the SNP's answer will always be independence.
@mattyt339 @99_hp Diane is not the best of anything.
@Maureen56596209 @NeurolawGuy No-one would confuse the SNP with a ray of sunshine. Their every silver lining has its cloud.
@cm_mid @BrianSpanner1 Yes, Angus Brendan is consistently thick as mince, and not afraid to prove it time after time.
@graeme_from_IT @AyrshireBog @maryconnor4567 To the SNP, truth is just a lie which too few voters have so far been conned into believing.
@debbiesimone123 @natkiddd76 @briantwid @wirralphil1 @IanDunt Having seen his TL + associates, I'm blocking this clown and 41 followers.
@briantwid @debbiesimone123 @wirralphil1 @IanDunt Some of us are so experienced we remember losing back from 1983. And Corbyn is no Foot.
@briantwid @debbiesimone123 @wirralphil1 @IanDunt And "Go and join the LDs!"? You really are a bit of a twat, aren't you? ðŸ˜
@briantwid @debbiesimone123 @wirralphil1 @IanDunt No, experienced in what belonging to a major political party entails.
@briantwid @debbiesimone123 @wirralphil1 @IanDunt Do feel free to show me where I said anything remotely like that.
@GlenMitchell1 He was, and he was also intelligent.
@AgentP22 Why? They've been blaming everything on Westminster since 1934 â˜º
@debbiesimone123 @briantwid @wirralphil1 @IanDunt It's the post-2015 intake who comprise most of his vote. Rejected by experienced members.
@RossFootball Agreed. Dim, grumpy, evasive and defensive just doesn't cut it for forensic political interviews on live TV and radio.
Scathing and accurate. The 313,209 members who did this to the Party - are you listening? â˜º https://t.co/a5YKOTCOC7
